snippet: Citing the hostage crisis at a gas facility in Algeria, Prime Minister David Cameron canceled a trip to Amsterdam to outline a pared-down role for Britain in the European Union.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron cancels long-anticipated, much-delayed speech in Amsterdam on Britain’s future in Europe, citing need to stay in London to be on hand for developments in hostage crisis in Algeria, where Britons are among captives taken by Islamic militants.
lead_paragraph: Citing the hostage crisis at a gas facility in Algeria, Prime Minister David Cameron canceled a trip to Amsterdam to outline a pared-down role for Britain in the European Union.

headline.seo: Cameron Postpones Talk on Britain’s Role in Europe
headline.main: Cameron Delays Talk on New Role in Europe
headline.print_headline: Cameron Delays Talk On New Role In Europe
